sentences.sentence: Lukashenko successfully persuaded Prigoziev to withdraw his forces when they were just 200 kilometers outside of Moscow, following several skirmishes involving army helicopters.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile in Moscow, Putin conducted a psalm ceremony honoring Russia's armed forces, saying they had helped avert a civil war. sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: MEPs in the European Parliament's Environment Committee celebrate their victory on Tuesday after lawmakers, mainly from the right, voted down the EU's so-called nature restoration law.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It's the first time that the committee has rejected legislation from the European Green Deal, which aims to make the continent much more climate friendly.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The rejection comes after the biggest political bloc in the parliament, the centre-right EPP group, launched an attack against the law, citing fears that the agricultural sector will be negatively impacted.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The baseline of the proposal was not good made.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: It's a very, very bad proposal.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: We don't know what happens in the different member states with this proposal.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: We have no clear impact assessment to food security.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And so the basic is not very good.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And so we said we need a good baseline to have a good proposal for nature restoration.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And I'm very sad that we have to go to this point.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And Vice President Timmermans doesn't realize in the last nine months that he made a bad proposal, took it back and make a better one. I'm very sad about this.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: MALCOLM BRABANT, The aim of the proposal is to restore habitats and species that have been degraded by human interference and climate change. Farmers across the E.U. fear that the plan will force them to give up production on some of their land to make way for forests, meadows and ditches.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: But supporters of the plan say this vision is short-sighted and endangers the E.U.'s Green Deal, which aims to reach climate neutrality by 2050.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: I think it is in danger. We will not reach our targets for biodiversity, for soil health, for healthy rivers, oceans, land. We will not reach our targets for sustainable agriculture and we will also not reach our climate targets because we need about 10% of the emission reduction which is enshrined in the climate law is supposed to come from ecosystems which absorb carbon.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: If we do not protect them, if we do not strengthen them by restoring them, we will not reach our climate targets.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: With summer holidays fast approaching, professionals in the tourism sector and political world met on Tuesday in Brussels for Destination Europe, a summit devoted to exactly this.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The aim was to discuss the challenges for an industry recovering from the pandemic and soaring inflation. Added to these challenges is the growing demand from travelers for sustainable tourism people are looking for real experiences we see that you know tourism is changing in a way that it's becoming almost like a social need people need a holiday to escape from their lives and so on but we want people to understand that tourism comes with a responsibility towards local communities you know entrepreneurs but also towards yourself that you want to do something that which is not only good for yourself but it's good also for environment, for society and for people around you.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: According to a booking.com survey tourists want to travel in a more sustainable way. This year three-quarters of respondents said they want to go on holiday with a lower carbon footprint.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: But often, they encounter obstacles in the process.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: We know that there are some barriers that they're facing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: So while they have intent, there's also something that's getting in their way, and that's the cost, or their perception of cost, that is. So they feel that sustainable options are too expensive, and it's also the idea that there's too few options for them to choose from.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: So we have 50 percent of our travelers telling us that the sustainable options are too expensive.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Interestingly, there's also 50 percent of our travelers that are telling us that they're willing to pay more for a sustainably certified experience or accommodation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: This climate commitment can take the form of eco-certification or carbon emission details. Either way, for the EU, the stakes are high. Europe remains the world's top travel destination, with the sector representing 10% of the continent's GDP.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Tourism also represents between 25 and 30 million direct jobs in Europe.

sentences.sentence: Reformist Austrian artist Gustav Klimt's Lady with a Fan has become the most expensive painting in Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The masterpiece, which was in the hands of its previous owner for 29 years, has become the most expensive painting in Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The masterpiece, which was in the hands of its previous owner for 29 years, was sold by Sotheby's Auction House in London on Tuesday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Described as full of boundary-pushing experimentation, this work is radically different from his better-known gilded oil painting, The Kiss.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The colourful portrait of a mysterious woman was also the artist's last and was discovered on his easel after he died unexpectedly in 1918.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Previously, the most expensive artistic work ever auctioned in Europe was Walking Man Eye, a six-foot bronze cast by Swiss sculptor Alberto Giacometti, which sold for an earth-shattering 76 million euros in 2010.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The Hermitage Museum in Amsterdam, which a year ago broke off relations with the original Hermitage in in St. Petersburg will be renamed the Heart Museum as of September.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Since its opening in 2009, the Amsterdam Museum has functioned as an annex of its Russian namesake, curating many exhibitions from its famous collection.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The Heart Museum will now collaborate closely with three Western giants, the British Museum in London, the Pompidou Center in Paris and the Smithsonian American Art Museum in Washington.
